column4: Anyone here know how the Dell Vostro 1000 laptop fairs with Ubuntu support?
what are the specs?
if it's for general use--you're golden; something else in mind? or certain issues you have?
you should download the livecd and try it out, see how much of your hardware, wireless it can recognize
haven't heard about that particular model, heard about the 1400 something--good reviews on that you might want to check ubuntuforums for that model though
does it run fairly smoothly--does the system recognize your wireless card,etc?
just look in the network settings once booted? or should I use dmesg or something like that
do the restricted driver manager show the card driver?
I haven't purchased the laptop yet. I want to try to test it at the store before purchase
best to google and check ubuntuforums as well linux on laptops website first then
thanks
no worries :}
adblockplus is an extension?
how many extensions
the only extension is the "Ubuntu Firefox Modifications 0.5"
how much ram, what other special effects (ie compiz) running, how many flash tabs open etc
2gb RAM, no special effects.. currently 3 tabs with flash (it is the side ads on howtoforge.org)
is that link for me??
imo get adblockplus, limit open flash tabs for starters
yes
I would also check if you have any fancy themes going; some are not that well done and could conflict with ff
I am boring, I use the standard theme that installs by default with Ubuntu
is it the same for 12.04? I thought I has seen somewhere that you apt-get gnome-session-fallback  I haven't been able to confirm that though
